channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overgrown and hanging trees, 10th August
item.description:
The alleyway leading on from Elmstead heights close runs behind our garden at 14 Fenton Close. The trees behind our property are extremely overgrown and overhanging into our garden. One of the trees is overhanging into our garden and on to our shed roof. Please can these be cut back as soon as possible. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cow Path, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous street light, 10th August
item.description:
Several months ago a car crashed into the street light taken it down on the A205 ,it has been partially removed but not completely r replaced ,it is now a huge danger and considering the huge footfall on this road ,the hoarding around it now has falling down , obstructing the pavement .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Road, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Street Light - Equipment damaged, pole leaning

item.title: Noisy biilding works on a Sunday, 10th August
item.description:
There is ongoing building works at 106 Osbaldeston Road and the builders appear to be working on a Sunday. I think there are restrictions on the noise levels on a Sunday!
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Forburg Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Cat activity centre dumped by bins., 10th August
item.description:
Been here for months now . Pretty sure no cats will be taking this. Can it be removed by the council please? Rowton road is a fly tip hotspot please check regularly, always lots of other peoples disgusting rubbish.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rowton Road, Shooters Hill, London

item.title: Elizabeth Way Veolia Purple Bag near flats, 10th August
item.description:
Hi, the only reason I am logging this is because walking past earlier today it looks like an animal has torn into the bag, we don't want to undo the good work a volunteer has done by allowing the contents to be back on the streets, also that you may not be aware of it's location. Apologies if this is a duplicate but have checked FMS before logging. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Elizabeth Way, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sharp end of screw protruding from log fence due to missing logs., 10th August
item.description:
The sharp screw end is at the height of the head of a toddler and could cause a serious injury. There are pieces of the log fence missing hence the screw protrusion and the toddler being able to move across it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Audrey Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Church patrons blocking footpath on both sides, 10th August
item.description:
The Eritrean church goers continue to block the footpath on both sides of the street with people and prams. Pedestrians and non-church goers attempting to pass through are forced into the street. This needs to stop. The traffic and heaps of people that come into the area to attend the church are bad enough but blocking footpaths is unacceptable
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61, Edmund Street, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet
